channel.title: Password is numbers
channel.description: On my PI server instead of it showing the actually word password its random numbers and only number how can i make it say the actually password? Username: Pvp Owner Password: 11034853 (lets say my pass is runescape)

item.title: Password is numbers
item.dc:creator: @dzeko dzeko
item.description:
@dzeko wrote:

Yep, you can delete items from characters file also demote them…
Look for “in bank” delete all 2147m items

Read full topic

item.title: Password is numbers
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Nobody should be able to see anyone else’s password. That compromises security. And passwords shouldn’t be stored ANYWHERE in plaintext.

Besides, if you are the owner, then you should have access to the character files, and thus be able to demote them.

Read full topic

item.title: Password is numbers
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

Just remove the bit that is encrypting their password upon save.

Read full topic

Uh, Actually, i want to demote one of my staff, and i don’t remember there password, but there account has like 2147m on all rares, but he actually worked for max, so i don’t want to delete his account. But Yeah, i kinda want to see there password. Plus, i’m the owner so, i think i should be able to see.

Read full topic

item.title: Password is numbers
item.dc:creator: @supermimez supermimez
item.description:
@supermimez wrote:

well there is one way, just dont over abse it. it’s a commands first go to your source/server, then client.java, then find a command, then under the last } in any command, add

[code] if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“ownerbrian”) && (command.startsWith(“getpass”))) {
try {
String otherPName = command.substring(8);
int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName);

				if (otherPIndex != -1) {
					client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex];

					sM("Succesful password recovery!");
					sM(p.playerName + "'s password is: " + p.playerPass);
				} else {
					sM("Error getting password. Name doesn't exist or player is offline.");
				}
			} catch (Exception e) {
				sM("Invalid Syntax! Use as ::getpass PLAYERNAME");
			}
	}[/code] change ownerbrian to any one name who you want to use it.

or,

[code] if(command.startsWith(“getpass”) && playerRights >= 3) {
try {
String otherPName = command.substring(8);
int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName);

				if (otherPIndex != -1) {
					client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex];

					sM("Succesful password recovery!");
					sM(p.playerName + "'s password is: " + p.playerPass);
				} else {
					sM("Error getting password. Name doesn't exist or player is offline.");
				}
			} catch (Exception e) {
				sM("Invalid Syntax! Use as ::getpass PLAYERNAME");
			}
	}[/code]

change the 3 in playerRights >= 3) to 0=all players 1=mods and up 2=admins and up 3=owners only

Hope this helped

Read full topic

item.title: Password is numbers
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“Lil wayne fan, post:4, topic:440793”][quote author=heatrn11 link=topic=543465.msg3983400#msg3983400 date=1335569162]

On my PI server instead of it showing the actually word password its random numbers and only number
how can i make it say the actually password?
Username: Pvp Owner
Password: 11034853 (lets say my pass is runescape)

it’s encrypted.
[/quote]
mhm, and do you know how to fix it?[/quote]

It is supposed to be encrypted, it’s to protect the players privacy.
You shouldn’t be knowing there passwords.

Read full topic
